net.cloud.server.file.address

Class FileAddressBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.server.file.address.FileAddressBuilder

  • public class FileAddressBuilder
extends Object
    This class is useful for building a FileAddress. (As the name implies...) To use it, obtain a new instance via the static factory method. Then, call methods on the builder instance to specify which file you're after. Some of the calls will overwrite previous calls, of course.

    Ex:
    FileAddressBuilder builder = FileAddressBuilder.newBuilder();
    builder.space(AddressConstants.SPACE_COMMAND_SCRIPTS);
    builder.filename("echoScript");
    builder.extension("txt");
    FileAddress address = builder.createAddress();

    As a convenience, and to reduce knowledge of file naming, this is equivalent:
    FileAddressBuilder builder = FileAddressBuilder.newBuilder();
    FileAddress address = builder.createCommandScriptAddress("echoScript");

      • newBuilder

        public static FileAddressBuilder newBuilder()
        Obtain a new instance of a builder object, so you can obtain a FileAddress
        Returns:

      • space

        public FileAddressBuilder space(String addressSpace)
        Specify the address space (i.e. the folder) the file is in
        Parameters:
        addressSpace - The folder the file is in. Refer to AddressConstants
        Returns:
        This builder object

      • filename

        public FileAddressBuilder filename(String fileName)
        Specify the name of the file. This is without extension or any indication of folder
        Parameters:
        fileName - The name of the file
        Returns:
        This builder object

      • extension

        public FileAddressBuilder extension(String fileExtension)
        Specify the file format. Do not include the dot ('.')
        Parameters:
        fileExtension - The extension of the file, without the dot
        Returns:
        This builder object

      • createCommandScriptAddress

        public static FileAddress createCommandScriptAddress(String scriptName)
        Create and return a FileAddress object in one go. In particular, the address will lead to a file for executing a command script.
        Parameters:
        scriptName - The name of the script
        Returns:
        A FileAddress which can be used to request the file

      • createLogFileAddress

        public static FileAddress createLogFileAddress(String logName)
        Create and return a FileAddress which will lead to a file to be used as a log report. This file will be created essentially on a per-run basis where it can be located by time of run.
        Parameters:
        logName - The name to define the log, so there may be specific log files
        Returns:
        A FileAddress for creation of a log file

      • createPlayerDataAddress

        public static FileAddress createPlayerDataAddress(Player player)
        Create and return a FileAddress which will lead to the file storing a player's save data
        Parameters:
        player - The player object to get the save file for
        Returns:
        A FileAddress for player save data

      • createPlayerDataAddress

        public static FileAddress createPlayerDataAddress(String username)
        Create and return a FileAddress which will lead to the file storing a player's save data
        Parameters:
        username - The username of the player
        Returns:
        A FileAddress for player save data

      • createXmlDataAddress

        public static FileAddress createXmlDataAddress(String resName)
        Create and return a FileAddress for an XML data resource file.
        Parameters:
        resName - The name of the XML resource (filename)
        Returns:
        A FileAddress to the XML file

      • createAddress

        public FileAddress createAddress()
        Obtain a new FileAddress object which will refer to the file this builder has been making a path to. No exceptions will occur if the builder has not been fully specified.
        Returns:
        A FileAddress reflecting this builder's current state

      • createString

        public String createString()
        Obtain a String rather than a FileAddress
        Returns:
        A string for the address, reflecting this builder's current state
